skill.name: reactome-database
skill.description: Query Reactome REST API for pathway analysis, enrichment, gene-pathway mapping, disease pathways, molecular interactions, expression analysis, for systems biology studies.
skill.summary: Query Reactome REST API for pathway analysis, enrichment, gene-pathway mapping, disease pathways, mo...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or exfiltration patterns found. Network calls target documented Reactome APIs and match the stated purpose.

content.value_statement: You need pathway context for genes and expression results. This skill queries Reactome APIs and summarizes enrichment results quickly.
actual_capabilities: Get Reactome database version from the Content Service
Query pathway details by stable identifier
List participating physical entities for a pathway
Run overrepresentation analysis from a gene list file and save JSON results
Generate a Reactome Pathway Browser link for top results
limitations: Requires internet access to reach reactome.org APIs
Input gene list must be plain text with one identifier per line
Analysis token retrieval is not exposed as a CLI command
Results quality depends on Reactome curation and API availability

use_cases.title: Check pathway enrichment
use_cases.description: Submit a gene list and review enriched pathways with p values and FDR.

use_cases.title: Map pathway entities
use_cases.description: List entities in a pathway to validate gene to pathway mappings.

use_cases.title: Learn pathway context
use_cases.description: Search pathways by term and read high level pathway summaries.

prompt_templates.title: Get database version
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the current Reactome database version and explain what it means for reproducibility.

prompt_templates.title: Query pathway by ID
prompt_templates.scenario: Find pathway details by stable ID
prompt_templates.prompt: Query pathway R-HSA-69278 and summarize its name, species, and description in plain language.

prompt_templates.title: Search pathways
prompt_templates.prompt: Search Reactome for pathways related to glycolysis and list the top results with their IDs.

prompt_templates.title: Run enrichment analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: Analyze a local gene list file
prompt_templates.prompt: Run Reactome overrepresentation analysis on gene_list.txt and summarize the top five pathways with FDR values.

output_examples.input: Analyze gene_list.txt and summarize top pathways
output: Top pathway: Cell Cycle, Mitotic (R-HSA-69278), FDR 0.0016
Found 15 of 450 entities in the pathway
Browser link provided for interactive review

best_practices: Use batch gene lists to reduce repeated API calls
Store the analysis token to retrieve results later
Filter pathways by FDR to focus on significant results
anti_patterns: Submitting identifiers one at a time in separate requests
Using non standard identifier formats without validation
Ignoring API errors and missing responses

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code
faq.answer: Yes, it provides prompts and scripts that can be used in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: What limits should I expect
faq.answer: Reactome does not enforce strict limits but large lists can be slower and tokens expire after seven days.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my pipeline
faq.answer: Yes, the Python helper script can be called from pipelines and outputs JSON files.

faq.question: Does it access my credentials or private data
faq.answer: No, it only reads the gene list file you provide and calls Reactome public APIs.

faq.question: What if the API request fails
faq.answer: Check network access, verify identifiers, and retry with smaller lists.

faq.question: How does it compare to reactome2py
faq.answer: This skill uses direct REST calls, which can be more current than the older reactome2py package.
